subject: Re: [junit] Re: one-time setup
msgSnippet: ... In my own defense: The main() method was checking the error handler to see if any errors had been recorded, to decide what kind of exit condition was
messageBody:
Eric Armstrong wrote:

> ...I was horrified to discover that the error handler object
> was, indeed, declared as a static variable.

In my own defense:
The main() method was checking the error handler to see if any errors

had been recorded, to decide what kind of exit condition was
appropriate.
To access it from the static main() method, I had made the error
handler
static. So I fixed by extracting the data into static variables from
the run()
method. Ugh. But at least it all works now...
